thread.section_title: The Times & The Sunday Times: breaking news & today's latest headlines
thread.title: EY to axe 150 senior consultants as demand for advice withers
thread.title_full: EY to axe 150 senior consultants as demand for advice withers

author: Laith Al-Khalaf, Business Reporter
title: EY to axe 150 senior consultants as demand for advice withers
text:
EY is preparing to axe 150 senior consultants and replace the head of the division as the “Big Four” accountancy firm grapples with a downturn in demand for advisory services.
The cuts in its consultancy division, which employs 4,700 people, will fall on managers, senior managers and directors, according to sources close to the situation. These are the highest paid roles below partner level.
Benoit Laclau, EY’s head of consulting and one of its most senior executives, is also stepping down from his post after five years. Laclau, 53, has held senior positions at both the UK firm and its global arm, which sits above each of its semi-autonomous partnerships, over the course of his 12-year stint with EY.
An EY spokeswoman said: “Benoit Laclau
